name: CreateScheduleOverride
description:
Create schedule overrides for specific users and time ranges.

This tool creates one or more schedule overrides for specific users covering specified time periods. Overrides are used to manage on-call schedules. It should be called when you need to modify or assign on-call duties temporarily, ensuring the latest override has priority if overlapping occurs.

parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the schedule resource to which the override will be applied.

parameters.name: api_version_accept_header
parameters.description: Specify the version of the API by using the 'Accept' header format, e.g., 'application/vnd.pagerduty+json;version=2'.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specifies the media type of the resource. Use 'application/json' for this endpoint.

parameters.name: override_details
parameters.description: A JSON object containing an array of overrides to be created. Each override specifies the user and the time range they will cover.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
